channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Convolutional Initialization for Data-Efficient Vision Transformers
item.description: Training vision transformer networks on small datasets poses challenges.

item.title: DiffMoog: a Differentiable Modular Synthesizer for Sound Matching
item.description: We introduce an open-source platform that comprises DiffMoog and an end-to-end sound matching framework.

item.title: LLMCheckup: Conversational Examination of Large Language Models via Interpretability Tools
item.description: Interpretability tools that offer explanations in the form of a dialogue have demonstrated their efficacy in enhancing users' understanding, as one-off explanations may occasionally fall short in providing sufficient information to the user.

item.title: Wasserstein Differential Privacy
item.description: We propose Wasserstein differential privacy (WDP), an alternative DP framework to measure the risk of privacy leakage, which satisfies the properties of symmetry and triangle inequality.

item.title: Meta-Prompting: Enhancing Language Models with Task-Agnostic Scaffolding
item.description: This collaborative prompting approach empowers a single LM to simultaneously act as a comprehensive orchestrator and a panel of diverse experts, significantly enhancing its performance across a wide array of tasks.

item.title: Deep Neural Network Benchmarks for Selective Classification
item.description: The selective classification framework aims to design a mechanism that balances the fraction of rejected predictions (i. e., the proportion of examples for which the model does not make a prediction) versus the improvement in predictive performance on the selected predictions.

item.title: DAFA: Distance-Aware Fair Adversarial Training
item.description: The disparity in accuracy between classes in standard training is amplified during adversarial training, a phenomenon termed the robust fairness problem.

item.title: What the Weight?! A Unified Framework for Zero-Shot Knowledge Composition
item.description: The knowledge encapsulated in a model is the core factor determining its final performance on downstream tasks.

item.title: Shift-ConvNets: Small Convolutional Kernel with Large Kernel Effects
item.description: Experimental results show that our shift-wise operator significantly improves the accuracy of a regular CNN while markedly reducing computational requirements.

item.title: SGTR+: End-to-end Scene Graph Generation with Transformer
item.description: Moreover, we design a graph assembling module to infer the connectivity of the bipartite scene graph based on our entity-aware structure, enabling us to generate the scene graph in an end-to-end manner.

item.title: ClipSAM: CLIP and SAM Collaboration for Zero-Shot Anomaly Segmentation
item.description: Recently, foundational models such as CLIP and SAM have shown promising performance for the task of Zero-Shot Anomaly Segmentation (ZSAS).

item.title: Icy Moon Surface Simulation and Stereo Depth Estimation for Sampling Autonomy
item.description: The surface reflectance properties of icy moon terrains (Enceladus and Europa) are inferred from multispectral datasets of previous missions.

item.title: HAZARD Challenge: Embodied Decision Making in Dynamically Changing Environments
item.description: Recent advances in high-fidelity virtual environments serve as one of the major driving forces for building intelligent embodied agents to perceive, reason and interact with the physical world.

item.title: TroVE: Inducing Verifiable and Efficient Toolboxes for Solving Programmatic Tasks
item.description: Language models (LMs) can solve tasks such as answering questions about tables or images by writing programs.

item.title: NIV-SSD: Neighbor IoU-Voting Single-Stage Object Detector From Point Cloud
item.description: NIV strategy can serve as a bridge between classification and regression branches by calculating two types of statistical data from the regression output to correct the classification confidence.

item.title: Falcon: Fair Active Learning using Multi-armed Bandits
item.description: Given a user-specified group fairness measure, Falcon identifies samples from "target groups" (e. g., (attribute=female, label=positive)) that are the most informative for improving fairness.

item.title: Energy-based Automated Model Evaluation
item.description: The conventional evaluation protocols on machine learning models rely heavily on a labeled, i. i. d-assumed testing dataset, which is not often present in real world applications.

item.title: A Review of Deep Learning Methods for Photoplethysmography Data
item.description: In this review, we systematically reviewed papers that applied deep learning models to process PPG data between January 1st of 2017 and July 31st of 2023 from Google Scholar, PubMed and Dimensions.

item.title: PSAvatar: A Point-based Morphable Shape Model for Real-Time Head Avatar Creation with 3D Gaussian Splatting
item.description: In this paper, we introduce PSAvatar, a novel framework for animatable head avatar creation that utilizes discrete geometric primitive to create a parametric morphable shape model and employs 3D Gaussian for fine detail representation and high fidelity rendering.

item.title: BiTA: Bi-Directional Tuning for Lossless Acceleration in Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) commonly employ autoregressive generation during inference, leading to high memory bandwidth demand and consequently extended latency.

item.title: MAST: Video Polyp Segmentation with a Mixture-Attention Siamese Transformer
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, our MAST is the first transformer model dedicated to video polyp segmentation.

item.title: DREditor: An Time-efficient Approach for Building a Domain-specific Dense Retrieval Model
item.description: Motivated by this, we develop a time-efficient approach called DREditor to edit the matching rule of an off-the-shelf dense retrieval model to suit a specific domain.

item.title: VRMN-bD: A Multi-modal Natural Behavior Dataset of Immersive Human Fear Responses in VR Stand-up Interactive Games
item.description: Understanding and recognizing emotions are important and challenging issues in the metaverse era.

item.title: Temporal Blind Spots in Large Language Models
item.description: In this study, we aim to investigate the underlying limitations of general-purpose LLMs when deployed for tasks that require a temporal understanding.

item.title: Mastering Text-to-Image Diffusion: Recaptioning, Planning, and Generating with Multimodal LLMs
item.description: In this paper, we propose a brand new training-free text-to-image generation/editing framework, namely Recaption, Plan and Generate (RPG), harnessing the powerful chain-of-thought reasoning ability of multimodal LLMs to enhance the compositionality of text-to-image diffusion models.

item.title: Differentiable Tree Search in Latent State Space
item.description: In this work, we introduce Differentiable Tree Search (DTS), a novel neural network architecture that significantly strengthens the inductive bias by embedding the algorithmic structure of a best-first online search algorithm.

item.title: LKFormer: Large Kernel Transformer for Infrared Image Super-Resolution
item.description: Given the broad application of infrared technology across diverse fields, there is an increasing emphasis on investigating super-resolution techniques for infrared images within the realm of deep learning.

item.title: NeuroSynt: A Neuro-symbolic Portfolio Solver for Reactive Synthesis
item.description: At the core of the solver lies a seamless integration of neural and symbolic approaches to solving the reactive synthesis problem.

item.title: ALMs: Authorial Language Models for Authorship Attribution
item.description: In this paper, we introduce an authorship attribution method called Authorial Language Models (ALMs) that involves identifying the most likely author of a questioned document based on the perplexity of the questioned document calculated for a set of causal language models fine-tuned on the writings of a set of candidate author.

item.title: Revisiting Document-Level Relation Extraction with Context-Guided Link Prediction
item.description: Document-level relation extraction (DocRE) poses the challenge of identifying relationships between entities within a document as opposed to the traditional RE setting where a single sentence is input.

item.title: Unsupervised Machine Learning for the Classification of Astrophysical X-ray Sources
item.description: We provide a catalog of probabilistic classes for 8, 756 sources, comprising a total of 14, 507 detections, and demonstrate the success of the method at identifying emission from young stellar objects, as well as distinguishing between small-scale and large-scale compact accretors with a significant level of confidence.

item.title: Admission Prediction in Undergraduate Applications: an Interpretable Deep Learning Approach
item.description: This article addresses the challenge of validating the admission committee's decisions for undergraduate admissions.

item.title: PointGL: A Simple Global-Local Framework for Efficient Point Cloud Analysis
item.description: Efficient analysis of point clouds holds paramount significance in real-world 3D applications.

item.title: Universal Neurons in GPT2 Language Models
item.description: In other words, are neural mechanisms universal across different models?

item.title: Guiding the Search Towards Failure-Inducing Test Inputs Using Support Vector Machines
item.description: In this paper, we present NSGA-II-SVM (Non-dominated Sorting Genetic Algorithm with Support Vector Machine Guidance), a novel learnable evolutionary and search-based testing algorithm that leverages Support Vector Machine (SVM) classification models to direct the search towards failure-revealing test inputs.

item.title: SFC: Shared Feature Calibration in Weakly Supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Specifically, we leverage the class prototypes that carry positive shared features and propose a Multi-Scaled Distribution-Weighted (MSDW) consistency loss for narrowing the gap between the CAMs generated through classifier weights and class prototypes during training.

item.title: Towards Effective and General Graph Unlearning via Mutual Evolution
item.description: With the rapid advancement of AI applications, the growing needs for data privacy and model robustness have highlighted the importance of machine unlearning, especially in thriving graph-based scenarios.

item.title: Knowledge Navigation: Inferring the Interlocking Map of Knowledge from Research Trajectories
item.description: "If I have seen further, it is by standing on the shoulders of giants," Isaac Newton's renowned statement hints that new knowledge builds upon existing foundations, which means there exists an interdependent relationship between knowledge, which, yet uncovered, is implied in the historical development of scientific systems for hundreds of years.

item.title: GI-PIP: Do We Require Impractical Auxiliary Dataset for Gradient Inversion Attacks?
item.description: Deep gradient inversion attacks expose a serious threat to Federated Learning (FL) by accurately recovering private data from shared gradients.

item.title: NLCG-Net: A Model-Based Zero-Shot Learning Framework for Undersampled Quantitative MRI Reconstruction
item.description: Typical quantitative MRI (qMRI) methods estimate parameter maps after image reconstructing, which is prone to biases and error propagation.

item.title: FedGTA: Topology-aware Averaging for Federated Graph Learning
item.description: Existing FGL studies fall into two categories: (i) FGL Optimization, which improves multi-client training in existing machine learning models; (ii) FGL Model, which enhances performance with complex local models and multi-client interactions.

item.title: A Fair Evaluation of Various Deep Learning-Based Document Image Binarization Approaches
item.description: We evaluate them on different Document Image Binarization Contest (DIBCO) datasets and obtain very heterogeneous results.

item.title: TurboSVM-FL: Boosting Federated Learning through SVM Aggregation for Lazy Clients
item.description: Federated learning is a distributed collaborative machine learning paradigm that has gained strong momentum in recent years.

item.title: SubgroupTE: Advancing Treatment Effect Estimation with Subgroup Identification
item.description: Precise estimation of treatment effects is crucial for evaluating intervention effectiveness.

item.title: Augmenting Prototype Network with TransMix for Few-shot Hyperspectral Image Classification
item.description: However, observing the classification results of existing methods, we found that boundary patches corresponding to the pixels which are located at the boundary of the objects in the hyperspectral images, are hard to classify.

item.title: Broiler-Net: A Deep Convolutional Framework for Broiler Behavior Analysis in Poultry Houses
item.description: Detecting anomalies in poultry houses is crucial for maintaining optimal chicken health conditions, minimizing economic losses and bolstering profitability.

item.title: Analyzing the Effectiveness of Large Language Models on Text-to-SQL Synthesis
item.description: This study investigates various approaches to using Large Language Models (LLMs) for Text-to-SQL program synthesis, focusing on the outcomes and insights derived.

item.title: Beyond TreeSHAP: Efficient Computation of Any-Order Shapley Interactions for Tree Ensembles
item.description: While shallow decision trees may be interpretable, larger ensemble models like gradient-boosted trees, which often set the state of the art in machine learning problems involving tabular data, still remain black box models.

item.title: Cheap Learning: Maximising Performance of Language Models for Social Data Science Using Minimal Data
item.description: These `cheaper' learning techniques hold significant potential for the social sciences, where development of large labelled training datasets is often a significant practical impediment to the use of machine learning for analytical tasks.

item.title: Subgroup analysis methods for time-to-event outcomes in heterogeneous randomized controlled trials
item.description: Identifying such heterogeneous treatment effects is key for precision medicine and many post-hoc analysis methods have been developed for that purpose.
